official-title.#text:
Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the District of Columbia Special Olympics Law
			 Enforcement Torch Run.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following concurrent resolution; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Referred to the House Calendar and ordered to be printed

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Speaker of the House of Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may jointly designate,
			 the 29th annual District of Columbia Special Olympics Law Enforcement
			 Torch Run (in this resolution referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Rules and Administration of the Senate

term.#tail:
) may be run through the Capitol Grounds to carry the Special Olympics torch to honor local Special
			 Olympics athletes.

text.#text: On October 3, 2014, or on such other date as the

header.#text: Authorization of use of Capitol Grounds for D.C. Special Olympics Law Enforcement Torch Run

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take such actions as may be necessary to carry out the event.
may prescribe conditions for physical preparations for the event.
shall provide for enforcement of the restrictions contained in

, concerning sales, advertisements,
			 displays, and solicitations on the Capitol Grounds, as well as other
			 restrictions applicable to the Capitol Grounds, in connection with the
			 event.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 5104(c) of title 40, United States Code
